adverbs.description: trimly (comparative more trimly, superlative most trimly)

entries.meaning: In a trim manner; neatly, smartly.
(obsolete) Effectively, handily, nicely, thoroughly, soundly, well.
examples: And it is sayde both moste trimly and truly in the Epistle to the Hebreues, as we heard afore: If ye be not vnder correction, (wherof all are partakers) then are ye bastardes and not sonnes.
